message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of our product with you. I believe it's a game-changer and I'm confident you'll love it. As we discuss the price, I want to start with a competitive offer of $1300000. This is a great opportunity for you to get an amazing product at a fair price. What do you think?

I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1150000. I'm really interested in the product, but I have a budget to stick to and I'm not sure I can go any higher than that.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand your budget constraints, but I'm still very confident in the value of this product. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer a counteroffer of $1225000. This is a compromise that I think will benefit both of us. What do you think?

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $1200000 for the product. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I understand that you're trying to stay within your budget, but I'm still not comfortable selling the product at $1200000. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer a counteroffer of $1210000. This is as low as I'm willing to go, and I hope you can see the value in the product at this price. What do you think?
